text:
Welcome to How To Cook That
I am Ann Reardon
Today we are making chocolate oscars.

Firstly you will need a mold, I got this plastic
one on ebay you can get smaller ones or the
one large Oscar like I have.

Fill the mold with tempered chocolate, or
if you don't want to temper then use compound
chocolate.

There is a video on the channel explaining
compound chocolate and tempered chocolate

and all of the different things that you need
to know just click on How TO cook That to

go through to the channel and you will find
those videos there.

Tap the mold and check there are no air bubbles
especially in the little places like the nose
and things like that.

Turn it over and tip out some of the excess
chocolate.

I going to fill the statue with popping sugar
you could use ganache if you want to do that

you'd need to scrape the excess chocolate
off the sides and let the shell set up and
then fill it with the ganache.

There are lots of recipes for ganache flavours
and other fillings on the two truffles videos.

If you're going for popping candy like I am
then scrape the excess chocolate into the

mold, this mold has annoying little bumps
around the edge which is making it difficult
to get all of the chocolate off.

Then top it up right to the top with more
chocolate.

And then run your pallette knife over the
top to smooth off the top and level it.
Then you want to leave those to firm up.

Once they are set they should just fall out
of the mold quite easily.

The reason I didn't make them hollow is they
are so narrow at the feet it is hard to get
them out of the mold if they are hollow.

Stand the two halves up, if you look here
they are not joining properly which is reflective

on the quality of the mold but I'll show you
how we are going to fix it.

Warm a tray in the oven and place both halves
onto the tray and then join both halves together.

Now to fix the gaps that we've got, add some
extra melted chocolate and just smooth it
along the line to fill those in.

Once that is all set take some edible gold
luster dust and using a dry paint brush dust
gold over the whole statue including the base.

The nominees for Best Animated feature are
The Croods, Ernest & Celestine, The Wind Rises,

Despicable Me 2 [music, applause] and Frozen
[music]

Olaf "Oscars, Oh I don't know why but I've
always loved the idea of winning an Oscars

and fame and all things hot"
[applause] Let me know who you think will
win the Oscar in the comments below.

Subscribe to How To Cook That for more chocolate,
cakes and desserts, leave your requests in
the comments.
Have a great week and I'll see you Friday.

[music Wedding Invitation by Jason Farnham
used with permission]
